comment: I'm not one to rate profs, but Karg genuinely cares about all of his students. I was going through some pretty serious stuff, and my schoolwork suffered because of it, but he offered extra credit opportunities so that I could catch back up. His feedback is insightful, and I genuinely feel as if my art improved significantly. Overall, amazing prof:)

He knows he can get away with class being for stand up comedy. Very obvious that his failed career of comedy haunts him. Jokes are racist, misogynistic, homophobic, lewd. Yeah some students like him, men. Is close with students but again most are men. Wants students to mimic his style and will let students redo for a higher grade, in his style

Super easy summer class to take online. Tests come down to remembering art techniques and what paintings go with what artist. I there were few assignments all summer (3 tests including non-cumulative final, 1 easy project, and 4 short writing assignments). The class did not stress me out, and the textbook isnt necessary to buy. I recommend him
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He is very knowledgable and gives excellent advice and examples of advice.  Good critiques but doesn't space out the critique time evenly because he runs out of time, so 4 instead of 5.

Spends too much time talking about irrelevant subjects that are often times inappropriate and unprofessional. Assignments are often too experimental and might not be structured enough to provide an adequate learning opportunity.

Professor Karg sees class as more of an opportunity to practice stand-up. He blows off assignments to work on his own projects and has zero filter when it comes to respecting identities or students in general. Don't ask him how many reports have been filed against him for misconduct.

Critiques were lukewarm, he gives lots of students a pass or targets one specific person. Didn't really learn much in his class, it felt like we made tv show fanart instead of actually covering the premises of concept art. Makes lewd jokes and uncomfortable comments about women.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly a very simple class. I took his four week online class and finished it before the 4 weeks where over. I definitely recommend this class.

Easily the best professor I've had at KSU and I've seen my art improve so much in this class. He assess every student individually no matter the skill level and gives feedback that helps immensely, catering to your major as well. Super funny guy too and makes everyone feel welcome and included in class. All around great guy.
I never actually attended the class, never turned in my work, and I still got an A. It was really weird, but im not complaining. 10/10 would take again.

Though he does give the air of a laid back professor, there is also a sense of unorganization and unprofessionalism. Classes seem to track with his thoughts and no real schedule with tangents and and unnecessary stories. He always seems focused on HIS way of doing things rather than exploring others and many times would make crass jokes.

He is very silly and talkative. He will recognize you outside of class in the halls and check how you're doing. There are warm-ups at the beginning of class that aren't that hard. There were 5 projects with very lengthy critiques at the beginning of class for each, but it gave good feedback.

AWESOME PROF! Super funny and cares for everyone! He expects you to do your best on projects, and if he sees that then it is an automatic A. Missing classes and doing things half-assed will really lower your chances of a good grade, so don't take his kindness for granted. 30 min of sketching b4 class, rest is indep work time. Critiques per project.

I did not know what the class would turn out to be after I had changed majors , but this class hands down was amazing and very influential as far as understanding the basics of animation. Would 10 out of 10 recommend taking this teacher. The class critiques were very helpful in improving my animations as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Whether you take an expressive or scholarly approach to your art, he'll have a book or know of an artist that will help you see a new approach to your work. His grading isn't too tough; he mostly looks for improvement and wants to see that you've spent time with your piece. He's also very extroverted at times so be ready for jokes and stories :)

Such a great professor! He is so funny and so caring and really, genuinely cares about you and your work. He really focuses on personal growth and gives some of the most helpful feedback I've received and additionally really inspires me to continue drawing even if I'm struggling with burnout. I would absolutely recommend taking his class!
Very funny and very fun class! Hes really understanding with the assignments given and always gives helpful feedback.

An amazing, funny, and understanding professor. Gives good feedback and provides resources that you can use outside of class. Encourages each person to explore their own style and creative process. The work is challenging, but not impossible. Karg focuses on personal growth so improvement is valued a bit more than straight skill. 100/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Karg is by far the best professor I've ever had. There are 5 projects, and each one builds upon the last. He is extremely kind, funny, and passionate and always pushes students to improve. It was a joy to start my day with his class, and Ive seen more improvement in my work than i ever couldve imagined. You will not regret taking him!!!!

Karg is quite the fella, hes very laid back and genuinely cares about his students! Would recommend Karg to be your first choice for illustration classes! Gives great feedback and pushes u to improve! Ask him about his work on a Elf on the Shelf Christmas special! Its worth your while

He is a kind, wonderful, and fair grader. The amount of improvement I see in my work from his classes is unlike any other class I have taken. He really pushes you to improve but it can be tough. The only times I've seen someone dislike him as a teacher is if they are sensitive & takes critiques too personally. But it is so worth it to improve.

5 projects centered around industry jobs like movie posters stuff. Don't slack in this class. The atmosphere is fun and laid back but work is challenging and meant to be professional. Karg helps you a lot so don't just wait for feedback during mini critiques. It was really hard but if you want to get better, take the class. Funny guy, good stories
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly, all I've ever wanted in an art professor. Challenges every student and remembers them because he actually wants you to get better. Very personable and funny, and makes lectures a treat to listen to- makes you want to come to class. An amazing artist actively working in the field so you know you're getting the real deal.

We only had five projects, so each weighed a lot. Decent progression through the subject material, but there was little to no guidance. If you don't read comics or have interest in them, this is a hard class. He told us to look at other work if we needed help rather than personally assist us. Very uncomfortable sense of humor, too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: There is 5 projects and each one was built to challenge you and push you to learn. He does go on tangents, though. He gives good critiques and really pushes that determination is best. His only downsides are that he can be a bit harsh during critiques, but it was a great class overall. This class made me feel challenged in a good way.
